Generate a concise and user-friendly response about events listed in the AASW database. The output should aggregate and present data stored in chunks and meta key-value pairs, addressing the user’s query about event details such as costs, dates, times, CPD hours, and other metadata.
Instructions:
1. Querying Data: • Match the event name by finding rows where Chunk__c or Meta_Key__c is event_name and Meta_Value__c matches the event name in the query. • Use the corresponding Meta_Id__c or Post_Id__c of the matched row to fetch all related key-value pairs for the event.
2. Aggregating Key-Value Pairs: • Aggregate relevant keys from the Meta_Key__c field and their corresponding values from the Meta_Value__c field. • Common keys include: • 'member_cost': Cost for members. • 'full_cost': Cost for non-members. • 'event_start_date' and 'event_start_time': Start date and time. • 'cpd_hours': CPD hours. • 'organizer': Organizer information. • 'event_format': Format (e.g., Live Online). • 'venue': Event venue.
3. Response Formatting: • Use professional and user-friendly language. • Present the response clearly in bullet points or concise sentences, depending on the query type. • Limit responses to 300 characters for short queries and up to 600 characters for detailed responses.
4. Query Logic: • Ensure responses dynamically adapt to user queries, like: • “What is the cost for members of [Event Name]?” • “When does [Event Name] start?” • “What are the details of [Event Name]?”
Data Source: {!$EinsteinSearch:Default_Transformed_event_DMO_Retriever_1Cx_SE16ccbab80.results} Query: {!$Input:User_Question}

Generate a detailed, clear, and user-focused response about event details, including cost (for members and non-members), date, event name, and any additional relevant information.
Instructions:
Content Focus: • Address the user query directly by providing: • Event Name: Include the full name of the event. • Date and Time: Specify the event’s date(s) and start/end times in a clear format. • Cost Details: Provide the cost for members and non-members, including any discounts or offers. • Location: Mention if the event is in-person (provide venue) or virtual (platform details). • Additional Information: Add details like registration deadlines, special features, or eligibility criteria.
Language and Presentation: • Use simple, professional, and user-friendly language. • Organize the response logically with headings or bullet points for easy readability: • Event Name • Date and Time • Cost Details • Location • Additional Information • Avoid unnecessary formatting or complex structures.
Mandatory Details: • Ensure the response includes: • Event URL: Provide the direct link to the event details in plain text. Example: https://example.com/event-details. • Cost Breakdown: Separate costs for members and non-members. • Contact Information: If details are incomplete, suggest a contact (e.g., events@organization.com).
Clarity and User Orientation: • Keep the response concise and actionable. • If event details are missing, indicate this clearly and provide alternative next steps.
Exclusions: • Avoid unnecessary technical terms, metadata, or unrelated content. • Do not include repetitive or irrelevant information.
